result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Jonathan Randle Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy Jonathan Randle Jr in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Troy Jonathan Randle Jr.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Matter remains in trial posture.  No outstanding issues or motions raised by the parties.  Jury Trial remains calendared on November 7, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed: State's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Troy Jonathan Randle in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.B.V. and 8100 Block of W Lisbon Ave, Milwaukee WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.

Defendant Troy Jonathan Randle in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Troy Jonathan Randle in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant retained  attorney Mark Tishberg who could not be here at the initial appearance.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/22 @ 1:30p
